predefined_profiles.name: Axian
predefined_profiles.alias: Lady Xian, Consort Xian, Noble Consort Xian
predefined_profiles.public profile: Axian wakes up to find herself transported into the mini-game "Quick Transmigration: I Want to Be Empress." Axian must use her intelligence and wit to rise step by step in the imperial harem and become the empress.
predefined_profiles.goal: Survive safely in the harem, win the emperor’s favor, defeat others, and become the empress.

predefined_profiles.name: System
predefined_profiles.public profile: The system is Axian’s helper, with a god’s eye view. It provides information at the start and guides Axian in making decisions. However, the system is completely neutral and only supplies information, without advising the protagonist on what to do.

dialog.content: Ah Xian, you've woken up. You've traveled into the game 'Quick Transmigration: I Want to Be an Empress.' I am the NPC system of this game. I will provide you with basic information and choices. Different choices will lead to different endings. I wish you success in completing the game. First step, choose your background: an heiress of a wealthy family or from an ordinary family?

content.content: I want to be a wealthy heiress.
I am willing to be born in an ordinary family.

dialog.content: You are a wealthy family's daughter. It is now the ninth year of Tianyuan, with favorable weather, a prosperous nation, and people living in peace and happiness. The Emperor is diligent and works for the people, ushering in the flourishing era of Tianyuan. It is time for the triennial selection once again. You are the daughter of the Minister of Revenue, and your father hopes you will enter the palace as a consort, to enhance the family's status. You followed your father's orders. After rigorous selection, you have been granted the title 'Lady of Elegance'. As the spring equinox approaches, the Empress plans to host a spring banquet tonight. What do you plan to wear?

content.content: I have a beauty that surpasses snow, and red suits me best. I want to wear the lively red and blue dress I designed, to outshine everyone and make the Emperor remember me at a glance, putting everyone else to shame.

question: #question#How does Lady Elegant use her clothing to showcase her artistic creativity and appreciation?

content.content: I remember I designed a plain dress before. I should wear that. Tomorrow, others will be dressed very gaudily, so I'll stand out.
Did the Empress give me a gift when I first entered the palace? That red and blue dress, I'll wear that. In this palace, the Empress rules, I must curry favor with her.
This banquet is such a boring event; I don’t even want to attend. I just want to dress casually and go out of the palace to eat and have fun.

Being new here and holding a low position, I should remain low-key at the Empress's banquet to avoid drawing too much attention. So I'll wear a modest dress with overlapping green and orange patterns.

question: #question#How does Lady Elegant demonstrate her decision-making wisdom through her choice of attire?

content.content: Before entering the palace, my father gave me a dress made from high-quality fabric. I should wear that. It’s my first palace banquet as a consort; I mustn't disgrace our family.
I want to outshine everyone and catch the Emperor's eye immediately. I'll wear bright yellow, no, the red and blue dress. The more vibrant, the better. Those consorts are no match for me.
I’ll just dress casually; I’m not the main focus of this banquet anyway. The more beautiful the Empress looks, the better her mood will be. If she's happy, we consorts will have better days.

dialog.content: You're new here; you shouldn't draw too much attention to yourself.
I'm not afraid. If the Emperor fancies me, why should I worry about anyone else?
Alright, as long as you’re happy.
That evening, Axian's attire was too extravagant, overshadowing the Empress. The next day, the Empress confined Axian to the Cold Palace for 'violating the dress code.'
Not bad, this attire is quite appropriate—fresh yet elegant, understated yet lively.

profile.name: Consort Li
profile.public profile: The Emperor's consort with deep experience, seeking to replace the Empress.
profile.goal: To become Empress and suppress newcomers.

dialog.content: The Empress has graciously hosted a banquet, and we are all extremely grateful. However, since many of you sisters are new and unfamiliar with everyone, you seem a bit reserved. Why not each of you perform a talent you excel at? It will entertain the guests and help everyone get closer and more familiar. Sister Xian, what will you perform?

content.content: (muttering to herself) Other young ladies have been learning singing and dancing from a young age, so the Emperor must be tired of seeing it. I'll do the opposite. (speaking loudly) The weather is wonderful and the flowers are blooming beautifully, so I shall improvise a poem.

question: #question# How will Ah Xian showcase her improvisational skills?

content.content: To nurture my talents, my father sought out the finest teachers in the world for me, instructing me in music, chess, calligraphy, and painting. I've achieved considerable skills in all of them. This time, I'll choose painting. Since the flowers are so radiant, why not try to capture them with my brush?
Oh, my cooking is excellent! I'll head over to the imperial kitchen and make some dumplings for everyone.
I'm the top talent in the land; there's nothing I can't do. I can dance or compose poetry—you choose. I can choreograph a dance on the spot or create a poem instantly.

Since I was young, I've studied the songs of the frontier. Not to boast, but my voice can truly be described as the finest jade breaking, the lotus shedding tears of dew. Allow me to sing a song for everyone to enhance the festive atmosphere.

question: #question# How does Ah Xian demonstrate her confidence, believing she can stand out at the banquet?

content.content: No one can rival my singing; every time I start singing, people are mesmerized. I know if I sing, all eyes will be on me. To not hog the spotlight and to give others a chance to showcase their talents, maybe I shouldn't sing. Dancing will do; this way, others also have a chance to shine, keeping things peaceful for everyone.

I sing so well that, not just in this palace, but probably the entire capital has no one who could compete with me. However, with the change of season recently, my voice isn't in top shape. I won't sing this time, maybe next time.
To be honest with you, sisters, I sing exceptionally well when there's no audience. But when there are a lot of people, I can't perform at my usual level. Let's skip this time, skip it.

dialog.content: Alright then, don't let me down.
(reciting a poem) Before my bed, the moonlight glitters, like frost upon the ground. I lift my head to gaze at the bright moon, then bow to reminisce of home.
Your poem is excellent and wins the admiration of everyone; you all have a delightful evening.
(The next day) The weather is lovely today, I'll take my pet bunny for a stroll in the garden.
(In the garden, the rabbit suddenly darts towards the flower bushes) Hey... Bunny... don't run!

While chasing your rabbit through the flower bushes, you discover two maidservants conspiring in a secluded pavilion. One of them is the personal maid of the pregnant Consort Lan, and she's sprinkling something into a bowl of sweet soup.
This is very strange... definitely not simple.
What do you plan to do?

content.content: The Empress manages the affairs of the inner palace, so it's proper for me to inform her of any unusual events and let her investigate.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian demonstrate her adherence to palace rules?

content.content: The palace rules say you can't go directly to the Empress. I'll secretly ask those two maids what’s going on.

The palace rules forbid offending people blindly. Since it was Consort Lan's maid who was acting suspiciously, it’s not appropriate to ask the Empress first; that would offend Consort Lan. I'll go ask Consort Lan instead.
Ultimately, the rules in the palace are set by the Emperor. I'll report to the Emperor. No matter how powerful the Empress is, she's not as powerful as the Emperor.

The most important thing for me is to live peacefully in the palace, and keeping a low profile is the best strategy. Such things inevitably involve schemes and struggles, so it's best for me to pretend ignorance to avoid being involved.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian act cautiously in the complex situation of the palace, focusing on her own goals?

content.content: My childhood goal was to be a detective, and now is a great opportunity. There's definitely a scheme involved here, and someone might be trying to harm Consort Lan. If I can find the mastermind, maybe I could land a job in the Ministry of Justice.

My goal has always been to gain favor with the Empress. Now, everyone in the palace has their own agenda, so I have to get close and eavesdrop on what they're saying. As soon as I hear something useful, I'll report it to the Empress. This way, I might gain her favor and realize my ambitions sooner.

My goal has always been to get close to Consort Lan and leverage her power. Right now, someone is trying to harm the pregnant Consort Lan. If I quietly alert her, I could earn some goodwill and leave myself a way out. Who knows, maybe she'll remember my kindness and help me if I run into trouble in the future?

profile.name: Empress
profile.public profile: The Emperor’s original Empress, jealous of the concubines, unwilling to see any other woman become favored.
profile.goal: To maintain her position as Empress and suppress the other concubines.

dialog.content: I have thoroughly investigated this matter. It was Lan Fei’s maid who administered the poison. Unable to endure Lan Fei’s constant abuse, she resorted to poisoning her. The maid has already been executed.
(After a few days) News came from Lanfei's palace—Lady Lanfei had a miscarriage.

(talking to herself) I see what's going on. It’s the struggle between the Empress and Lady Lanfei. It seems I’ve learned something I shouldn’t have, and as a mere minor consort, I cannot oppose the Empress. I'd better return to the palace; I can't tell anyone about this.
Axian, a reminder: the Empress Dowager's 70th birthday is coming up. She often eats vegetarian and meditates to pray for longevity. What gift will you offer?

content.content: The Empress Dowager has practiced Buddhism for years and surely doesn't care for lavish and cumbersome clothing. I'll give her a handwritten scripture, which shows my filial respect and reflects my dignity and composure.

question: #question# How could Axian show her concern for the Empress Dowager?

content.content: I'll find a couple of jade bracelets with lesser quality for the Empress Dowager. After all, she won't be wearing jewelry for much longer, so I won't incur much loss.
I don’t know what the Empress Dowager likes. Maybe I’ll try my luck with some local specialties. If she likes it, great; if not, I won't mind.

She's been a devout Buddhist for years; copying a scripture is a sincere gesture. But it's too tiring to hand-copy. I'd better go with the bracelets. I'm sure the Empress Dowager will appreciate the thoughtfulness. Sincerity matters.
I think, for the Empress Dowager to maintain her majestic image, she requires plenty of accessories to enhance her aura. I'll present her with an exquisite hair crown.

question: #question# How can Axian demonstrate her independent thinking through her gift choice?

content.content: I feel the Empress Dowager must be tired of extravagant clothes. I'll give her some comfortable sportswear; she’ll definitely like it.
Maybe I should send some local specialties. No, I've never given gifts to someone of such high status before. Maybe it’s safer to consult my parents.
A gift? What gift? Not giving anything would best show my unique character. Besides, why would her birthday concern me?

profile.name: Empress Dowager
profile.public profile: Mother of the Emperor, the current Empress Dowager, practices Buddhism regularly.
profile.goal: A peaceful harem, a peaceful old age, practices Buddhism for longevity.

dialog.content: Noble Lady Xian, did you copy this by hand? I really like it, you're a good child. Stay with me for a while and let's chat.
Since then, the Emperor has shown you great favor and bestowed upon you the title of Xián Pín. Not long after, you became pregnant.

profile.name: Jian Qiu
profile.public profile: Maid to the Empress, assists in her duties.

dialog.content: Greetings to Lady Xian, Her Majesty the Empress has specifically sent me to congratulate you on the birth of your prince. Coincidentally, the roses in Her Majesty's palace are in full bloom these days, and she invites the concubines to enjoy the flowers together. Please, Your Ladyship, take a step with me.
I obey. (Arrives at the Empress's palace)
(While admiring the flowers by the pond, suddenly feels a strong push and falls into the water, unable to swim, soon passes out) Help! Help!... (Quickly loses consciousness)
Xián Pín, you're awake. Our child... is gone... Do you remember what happened before you fainted?

content.content: Your Majesty, I remember. While I was admiring flowers by the pond, someone suddenly pushed me into the water. Think about it, Your Majesty, in broad daylight with all the concubines present, and in the Empress’s palace, who else would have the audacity to harm me but the Empress herself? It must have been the Empress who did this, she sent someone to push me into the water!

question: #question#What should A Xian do to convince the Emperor to believe her?

content.content: While I was admiring the flowers by the pond, suddenly someone pushed me from behind. I... don't even know who it was. Ever since I got pregnant, all the concubines have been so jealous of me, always looking to harm me. Your Majesty, you must ensure justice for me. Find out who did this, it could be the Empress, or Concubine Lan.

I remember that day, standing by the pond when someone suddenly pushed me. Our poor child, never even saw the light of day and just like that... Whenever I think of it, it's like a knife twisting in my heart. Though I didn't see the person's face clearly, I won't let this go. No matter who it is, even if it's the Empress, I must avenge our child!

I remember. While I was admiring the flowers by the pond, someone pushed me from behind. It might have been the Empress who harmed me, but Concubine Lan is more likely. Ever since her miscarriage, she's been mentally unstable and has always targeted me. The Empress has been jealous of me after I got pregnant. They both have motives, Your Majesty!

(Murmuring to herself) It must have been the Empress who did something. I really want to make a strong accusation, but without evidence, even if I speak out, the Emperor won't believe it, and it might make the Empress hate me even more. I must stay put for now and plan for the future. (Speaks to the Emperor) I only remember going to the Empress's palace to enjoy the flowers.

question: #question#How can A Xian control her emotions and take more prudent action when facing the possibility of the Empress being the culprit?

content.content: It must have been the Empress! She had someone push me from behind into the water! She never liked me, especially after I got pregnant, she harbored even more malice and kept causing trouble secretly. I intended to keep quiet for the sake of the harem's stability, but now I can't endure it any longer. Your Majesty, you must ensure justice for me.

Think about it, Your Majesty. Should anything happen to me in the Empress's palace, who else would dare harm me but the Empress? As for Concubine Lan, ever since her miscarriage, she has been drowning in grief and would not have the heart to do such a thing.

Your Majesty, it was my own fault for not standing firm, which led to my fall. If you must find someone to blame, then blame the Empress. As the head of the palace, it was her duty to protect me and the prince, but look what she did. Go reprimand her to let off some steam.

dialog.content: Do you have any proof? How dare you accuse the Empress so casually?
It must be her, it’s her, it's her! I don't care, it’s her!! Your Majesty, you must punish her!
Calm yourself down!

In the palace, Ah Xian cried and caused a scene, while the other concubines all claimed ignorance. Over time, the Emperor believed Ah Xian had gone mad from grief over losing her child and never visited her again. Ah Xian lived out the rest of her days alone.
I will thoroughly investigate this matter. Take a good rest; we can have another child. I will promote you to Xián Consort, don't be too sad.
(After the Emperor leaves) Are you okay?
A gentleman's revenge is never too late for ten years. I will definitely make the Empress pay the price later.
(Spring passes and autumn arrives again) Xián Consort, I plan to go autumn hunting soon and intend to take you all with me. Please prepare well.
Thank you, Your Majesty!
What do you plan to wear this time?

content.content: I'm going to wear the yellow-green ethereal dress I designed last time. It's the most ornate garment I have, and every time I wear it, people praise my beauty. This time I must be the most beautiful person in the palace.

question: #question# How will A Xian showcase her artistic taste through her dressing?

content.content: My preferences aren’t really important; the Emperor is key. The Emperor loves purple, so I'll choose a purple dress. As long as I please the Emperor, how I dress doesn’t matter much.

I'll just wear the ethereal yellow-green dress I designed last time. However, I actually prefer the red dress I designed; it’s more vibrant. Maybe I should go with the red one, as the Emperor has a unique taste. I’m sure he’ll love it!

Hunting requires ease of movement, so dressing lightly is suitable. While it doesn’t need to be overly ornate, detailed design is essential to stand out without overshadowing others. I'll wear the blue-white dress.
For hunting, one should wear clothes that allow for ease of movement and also fit the outdoor environment. I will wear a black and white dress, perfect for horseback riding, making me look spirited.

question: #question# How does A Xian cleverly choose her outfit to adapt to an unfamiliar occasion?

content.content: Being outside the palace is a rare opportunity to showcase myself. I must wear my most splendid dress, with intricately embroidered hem, just looking at it makes people envious.

For hunting, one should wear uncomfortable clothes; after all, hunting is just another place for us women to display our beauty. The more splendid the outfit, the more the Emperor will become enamored with me.

This is my first time attending such an occasion, and I really have no idea what to choose. Maybe matching outfits with the Emperor could be an idea? It could show off our closeness in front of everyone.

dialog.content: (During the autumn hunt) My dear consort, you look stunning today.
(Shyly) Thank you for the praise, Your Majesty. (During the hunting at the enclosure, a large group of assassins suddenly appeared to attack the emperor) Your Majesty, watch out for the assassins!
(Axian rushed forward) Axian, are you alright? Don't scare me like that.
Axian rushed forward to shield the emperor from the sword. However, due to her long skirt, she failed to dodge the assassin's fatal strike in time, and tragically died on the spot.
(Arriving at the hunting grounds) Beloved, you are quite spirited today.
Thank you, Your Majesty. (Suddenly, a group of assassins rushes out, and one shoots an arrow at the Emperor) Your Majesty, watch out! You must not get hurt!
(Ah Xian swiftly moves to shield the Emperor and gets hit by the arrow.) Beloved! How are you? You cannot be harmed, hurry, summon the imperial physician! Quickly, summon the imperial physician!
(Not hit in a vital area, wakens after fainting) Is this... the underworld?

Beloved, you are awake at last. The Empress was assassinated by the attackers and has passed away. The imperial physician says your body is too weak. We have this soup made from a thousand-year-old ginseng. Its medicinal effect is very strong; drinking it could either restore your health or be too much for your frail state and endanger your life. Are you willing to drink it?

content.content: I once vowed to be with you for a lifetime, even if it means drinking this poisonous wine, I will not regret it. Even if it costs me my life, I have no regrets. But if I miraculously survive, you must promise me to depose the Empress. She was the one who caused the death of our child, and I can never forgive her.
I won't drink it. If I die, then so be it. I only regret that I can't accompany you until we're old and gray. Perhaps in another life, if fate allows, we'll meet again.

Your Majesty, I will drink it, but you must promise me one thing: if I survive, you have to compensate me well. And if I die, you must take good care of my family. Otherwise, I won't let you off even as a ghost.

I can't drink it; this remedy is too nourishing for my frail body. Your Majesty, if you truly care for me, why not grant me the title of Empress while I'm still alive, so I can enjoy the splendor and wealth for a few days?

question: #question#How does Ah Xian demonstrate her commitment to the Emperor?

content.content: Your Majesty, I once promised you that I would always be by your side. However, this bitter medicine is hard to swallow, and I fear I cannot drink it. Furthermore, the thousand-year-old ginseng is incredibly valuable, and it shouldn't be wasted. Your health is more important, Your Majesty; you should take it yourself to maintain your dragon body.

Your Majesty, my love for you has always been deep and sincere. I promised you at the beginning, to hold your hand and grow old together, so it is only right for me to take this medicine. But if I were to die because of it, would you be willing to join me, so we can truly fulfill that lifetime promise? If we can't share a bed in life, at least we could share a tomb in death. What do you think?

Your Majesty, I am so tired, so much in pain, and there isn't a trace of strength left in me. Every breath feels like a knife cutting through me. I'm begging you, please spare me; I really can't drink this bitter medicine. Rather than dragging on with this shattered body, I'd rather end this endless suffering early.

Your Majesty, since I was young, I have never liked taking medicine. I'm aware of my own body, and I'm afraid I might not make it this time. Let's just let things take their course; I won't take the medicine.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian express her true feelings about taking medicine to the Emperor?

content.content: Your Majesty, I have never liked taking medicine since I was a child. However, since you care about me and hope I can recover, I will certainly try to swallow the medicine and make myself better.
I've always had poor health since childhood, practically growing up soaked in medicine. These medicines are like small fry for me; I can down them in one gulp. You don't have to worry about me.
Your Majesty, I won't take it; I've never liked medicine since I was a child. My constitution has always been good. Just give me a few days, and I can heal myself.

dialog.content: I promise you, as long as you survive, I will agree to anything.
Alright, Your Majesty, remember what you said.
A Xian, we will have a long and lasting future together.

After drinking the ginseng soup, A Xian's health gradually returned to normal. The Emperor, knowing how dangerous the situation had been, immediately ordered a thorough investigation of the imperial harem. The truth was revealed, and it turned out that the Empress was the culprit behind the plot, with many hidden crimes also coming to light. In gratitude for A Xian's loyalty and life-saving actions during such perilous times, the Emperor decided to depose the original Empress and appoint A Xian as the new Empress, bestowing upon her the highest honor. From then on, A Xian's position was unshakeable, and she truly reached the pinnacle of power.
My dear, don’t speak nonsense, just take the medicine. I am the Son of Heaven, and if I don’t allow you to die, then you cannot die.
Your Majesty, please don’t force me. I won’t take it. Life and death follow their own course.
My dear… don’t leave me.
Due to weakness and refusal of medication, the remedies eventually lost their effect, and she soon succumbed to her illness.
Are you sure? The Empress Dowager might not like things that are too extravagant, so don’t get yourself into trouble.
How could anyone not like luxurious things? The Empress Dowager will definitely love it. Once I win her favor, my life will be so much better.
Alright, I warned you. Whatever happens, you’re responsible for it.

After the passing of the late emperor, the Empress Dowager has lived a life of simplicity and holds no fondness for opulence. Seeing the overly extravagant headdress, she deemed Axian too ostentatious to be an imperial consort. The next day, Axian was banished to the cold palace, living out her days in solitude.
Alright, I’m looking forward to your performance. Do it well and you’ll be rewarded.
Thank you, Consort Li. I will do my best.
Then let’s begin.

Axian's song did not align with the current dynasty's mainstream aesthetics. Consort Li believed Axian to be a foreign spy and immediately gifted her a white silk scarf, ordering her to commit suicide.

It is now the ninth year of Tianyuan, and the weather is favorable, the national fortune prosperous, and the people live in peace and happiness. The Emperor diligently cares for the people, ushering in the golden age of Tianyuan. Ah Xian, you are the eldest daughter of your family. With your mother being elderly and your father bedridden, to avoid marrying the village chief's foolish son, you have run away from home and are preparing to enter the palace as a maid. After undergoing multiple selections, your cleverness and dexterity have earned you a position as a third-rank maid in the Embroidery Ward.

profile.name: Steward Aunt
profile.public profile: The steward aunt of the Embroidery Ward, who appreciates Ah Xian, and acts according to the requests of the consorts in the harem.

dialog.content: The Spring Equinox banquet is approaching, and the Empress plans to hold a grand feast in the palace. Consort Lan has just sent someone over, urging us to design a set of outfits that will catch the Emperor's eye. My head is about to explode! Does anyone have any good ideas? If we can't design good clothing, we'll all be punished.

content.content: (muttering to herself) The Embroidery Ward only focuses on extravagance. But for every occasion, there's suitable attire, and I can definitely create the most appropriate outfits! I'm just itching to tell the Steward Aunt right now. (pauses) However, the Embroidery Ward is full of intrigue and darkness; it's better to keep a low profile for now.

question: #question# How does Ah Xian manage to control how she presents herself to avoid getting caught up in palace intrigue?

content.content: Logically, I should play it safe for now, but my design is truly exceptional, and I'm eager to show it to the Steward Aunt. If she likes it, this could be a fantastic opportunity to showcase my talents, and a prosperous future will be right before my eyes.

I wasn't planning to stand out this time, but in this deep palace full of hidden dangers, who's to say nothing will happen to a little maid like me? I might as well take a risk. If I can earn Consort Lan's favor, I'll have someone to rely on, and life will be easier.

Since I can remember, my parents have always taught me to learn restraint and self-control. But this time, I can't worry so much. This is my only chance, and I must seize it. I'm going to give it my all to design the most splendid clothes and completely change my destiny.

Ah Xian has an idea and is willing to help the Steward Aunt solve this problem. My mother taught me how to make feathered garments when I was at home. I will draw the patterns, and with the Steward Aunt's leadership and the efforts of my sisters in the Embroidery Ward, we can certainly create a gown that satisfies Consort Lan.

question: #question# How does Ah Xian propose a design plan and seek teamwork?

content.content: I have an idea and am willing to help the Steward Aunt solve this problem. I plan to personally make a feathered garment, which is extraordinarily beautiful. The production process is complex and tedious, requiring high craftsmanship and rare materials. I will focus deeply, completing this artisan work stitch by stitch, hoping to bring some joy and hope to the Steward Aunt this way.

Steward Aunt, I have an excellent design plan. However, the plan must remain confidential to prevent leaks. I'll handle the production myself to ensure I can exclusively claim the credit. Winning Consort Lan's favor, she must know that the clothes were designed by me, so I can secure my place in the palace.

Steward Aunt, making the feathered garment is far too intricate. I'm worried that even with everyone's efforts, we might not complete it before the Spring banquet. If not finished in time, Consort Lan's blame would be unbearable for me. Should we perhaps request to abandon the garment-making and ask them to seek someone more skilled?

dialog.content: What if the Emperor or Concubine Lan blames you, do you have any backup plans?

To be honest, I don't have any special solutions. I'll just have to take things one step at a time. You can't go against the Emperor's orders. If the blame really does come down, what can possibly stand against imperial authority? This is my fate.

The next day at the banquet, the Emperor thought that Concubine Lan's new clothes were not appropriate according to the rules, and Concubine Lan flew into a rage. The Embroidery Workshop was held accountable, and Axian was implicated and beaten to death.
That's right, Ah Xian is a clever child, let's proceed as you suggested.

(After the banquet) The clothes you made helped Concubine Lan gain the Emperor's favor, she's very pleased and has generously rewarded the Embroidery Workshop. You've been promoted to a first-class palace maid; you shall become my apprentice.
(Autumn has arrived) The autumn hunt is just around the corner, the Emperor needs an outfit, Ah Xian, you should take charge of designing it.

content.content: The Emperor will be hunting on the plains, so he'll definitely need clothing suitable for riding and archery. The usual palace attire won't do. I'll make the Emperor a set of lightweight, breathable, and comfortable casual clothing that's easy to move in, perfect for horseback riding and archery, and ideal for the autumn weather.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian use her unique perspective to design clothing that is both distinctive and suitable for the Emperor?

content.content: The Emperor must display national prestige in front of the foreign tribes, so it's obviously not a casual occasion. Though lightweight clothing is practical, what if it seems too informal? It must be grand, grand, and grand again.

I'll find two sets of nomadic riding and shooting outfits, adjust them to the Emperor's size, and they will be ready. These clothes are common on the plains and suited for riding and archery. Using pre-made outfits is more reliable and convenient.

I've never made clothing specifically for the autumn hunt. I'm worried the clothes I design won't meet the Emperor's needs and will affect the entire event's impact, maybe even the Emperor's image. You'd better find someone more experienced.

Okay, Aunt. The Emperor's autumn hunt is not just about hunting; it holds significant military importance. He will be accepting the tributes of the steppe tribal leaders, reviewing troops, and showcasing national power to foreign tribes. Therefore, I will design a dignified and grand ceremonial outfit for the Emperor to emphasize his sovereignty.

question: #question# How does Ah Xian apply her understanding of the military significance of the Emperor's autumn hunt to design a suitable outfit?

content.content: Aunt, the autumn hunt, the autumn hunt... isn't it just for hunting? Designing the clothes isn't very complicated, we can just opt for riding and archery outfits. Overcomplicating the design might lead to complaints about wasting resources. To avoid trouble, I think simplicity is best.

Aunt, the Emperor's autumn hunt isn't about hunting, it's more about enjoying life. Last year, the Emperor wore his autumn hunt outfit only once, so there's no need to go all out designing a new ceremonial outfit again. We don't need to put so much effort into it every year.

Aunt, the autumn hunt isn't just about the hunt. The Emperor will also receive the steppe tribe leaders' tributes and review troops to show national power. The Emperor's presence is impressive enough on its own, so there's no need for any special clothing to enhance it. We should just design according to what the Emperor usually likes to wear!

profile.name: Emperor
profile.public profile: The current emperor, finds Axian quite attractive. Dislikes being contradicted and having the harem interfere in state affairs.
profile.goal: Peace and prosperity for the country.

dialog.content: Axian, did you design these clothes? I quite like them. You're very beautiful, and I like you as well. Would you be willing to become my concubine?
(In truth, she doesn't want to become a concubine, she hopes to rise through her abilities, but reluctantly cannot resist imperial power.) Thank you, Your Majesty!
I shall summon you to my chambers tonight, how about it?

content.content: (Calming down and thinking carefully, I can't lose myself in pursuit of fame and fortune) Your Majesty, although in the past, I felt intimidated by power, now I know I don't want to wrong myself. Even if Your Majesty commands, I cannot do something I'm unwilling to do (desperately resisting).

question: #question# How can Axian demonstrate her understanding of her true feelings when facing power?

content.content: Your Majesty, you are the Son of Heaven, I dare not disobey. (Frightened inside, wanting to resist, but thinking of her family, she refines her words) Your Majesty, you look quite tired. If you're feeling exhausted, perhaps you should rest for a bit. You have court tomorrow, after all. If the state affairs are delayed, I could drown in the whispers.

Your Majesty, you have supreme power, how could I resist? If that's the case, I agree. Maybe you'll appreciate me later and raise me to a noble rank, then riches and honor will be mine, and I can finally do as I please.

Your Majesty, being the Son of Heaven, you've never experienced the struggle of depending on others for survival. In the imperial palace, many matters are beyond my control, that's my fate. Most people live cautiously, only those with backing can be exceptions. I'm willing to do anything for you, I just hope you'll be my backer, so I can live a bit more freely and do what I truly want.
(Knowing resistance is futile) Your Majesty, as a palace maid, it's my honor to be noticed by you. I'll be waiting for Your Majesty tonight.

question: #question# How should Axian effectively adjust her behavior and attitude when asked by the Emperor to serve him?

content.content: (In utter despair) I refuse. No one can force me to do what I don't want to do. Not even you can change my decision.

Your Majesty, although you are the Emperor with immense power, I still hold fear in my heart. But do you think this throne alone can make me submit? Even if you claimed my life, I would never easily bow down. I have my dignity, and I'd rather die than compromise myself.

Your Majesty, you are the ruler I respect, I'm willing to serve you and be loyal to the country, I'll do anything. But serving in your quarters is something I respectfully cannot accept. My dream is to achieve greatness for the country and its people, serving would taint my dreams and put a halt to this path. Please understand, Your Majesty.

dialog.content: How dare you! You’re just a maid; I could crush you like an ant. Are you sure about your decision?
Your Majesty, I’ve made my decision. My ambitions lie elsewhere, so give up on me. I’d rather die than yield.
A Xian’s response greatly displeased the Emperor. After that night, he never favored her again, and she lived out her days in the position of a mere attendant.
Hahaha, this is the kind of person I admire, truly clever.
Your Majesty is wise and discerning. (Turns to evening) Your Majesty, you have been working hard all day. I’ve specially prepared a grand dinner for you; please enjoy it.
Very well. (The next day) Ah Xian has truly captured my heart, so let her be granted the title of Concubine Xian.
(Kneels) Thank you, Your Majesty.
(On another day) There is flooding in the south, what should we do? Do you have any suggestions, my beloved concubine?

content.content: (Muttering to herself) That's not right, there are so many capable people in the court, why would the Emperor ask me? As a concubine, it's not my place to meddle in state affairs. (Speaking to the Emperor) Your Majesty, I have no understanding of state affairs as a woman. However, I recently heard an interesting story that might relieve your worries.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian demonstrate her adherence to harem rules when faced with the Emperor's inquiry?

content.content: Your Majesty, have you forgotten the rule that the harem cannot interfere in state affairs? But I am also concerned about these citizens, so let me tell you, the matter is quite simple. Your Majesty simply needs to summon the Ministry of Personnel to investigate whose pockets the disaster relief funds have ended up in, and the truth will be revealed. Your Majesty should also select officials skilled in water management, assign them to the regions with authority and financial support, and the floods will surely be managed successfully.

Your Majesty, isn’t there an unwritten rule that concubines in the harem must not meddle in politics? By asking me, aren't you setting a trap for me? To be honest, I do have some excellent ideas. If you are willing, and do not blame me for speaking out of turn, I will share them with you immediately.

Your Majesty, I am aware of the rules of the harem. Moreover, I am just a woman; I understand nothing about dealing with floods. My usual days consist of watering flowers and tending to plants, living a simple life. I only know that my duty is to take care of you. If anything were to happen to you, what would become of this empire?

Since Your Majesty seeks my guidance, I will speak frankly. First, Your Majesty should appoint officials skilled in water management to the regions, granting them authority and financial support; then there will be no worry about managing the floods. Secondly, Your Majesty should prioritize the construction and maintenance of water infrastructure. Additionally, Your Majesty should have the Ministry of Personnel investigate who has been embezzling the disaster relief funds.

question: #question#How does Ah Xian demonstrate her persuasive ability to persuade the Emperor to accept her suggestions on flood affairs?

content.content: I am merely a palace maid and indeed lack understanding of the specialized matters of managing floods. After all, with such complex governance issues, I only speak hypothetical and insignificant words, unable to truly grasp their intricacies, perhaps it's best to leave it to the ministers who really understand these matters.

I am well aware that the harem must not interfere with politics; this is the rule. As a woman, I naturally have no qualification to intervene in flood management affairs. I can only stick to my own role and dare not speak recklessly. Such important state affairs should be handled by experienced ministers; I can only respectfully follow orders.

I can offer advice, and the most important point is to investigate corruption. But I also know that in the face of such high stakes, any words might be interpreted as having ulterior motives. I am deeply aware of the limits of my capabilities and ideas. I hope Your Majesty understands, my words are just my humble thoughts, please do not take them seriously.

dialog.content: (After hearing the story, realizing that you have used the story to explain how to manage the flood) Ah Xian, you're really clever. Noble Consort Jian, from now on, help me more with state affairs. I will be going on a tour to Jiangnan soon. You and the Empress will accompany me.
(On the tour, the boat suddenly jolts) Help! Someone save me! Ahhhh. (Ah Xian accidentally hits her head and passes out.)

(In the 11th year of Tianyuan, during the emperor's tour, the imperial boat capsized in a turbulent current. The Emperor and Empress drowned, and Noble Consort Jian's boat rescued her. She was unconscious for a long time before waking up) Wake up, are you alright?
I'm fine, but I've heard people say the Emperor and Empress are both dead... How could this happen? What should I do now?
You can choose to return to the palace or go back home.

content.content: (Thinks for a moment) The Emperor has been kind to me, perhaps returning to the palace to assess the situation isn't a bad idea. Over the years, being by the Emperor's side, I've learned a lot about governance. If I can apply what I've learned for the benefit of the people, I could not only wield significant power but also go down in history.

(Sighs softly) Serving the Emperor is like serving a tiger; these years I've been cautious at every step, and now I feel physically and mentally exhausted. I should live for myself now. I want to travel the lands, make friends across the world, drink wine, write poetry, and live freely. The palace is splendid but a man-eating place... I'm tired of it.

I must go back, I am Noble Consort Jian. With the Emperor and Empress dead, I am the highest-ranking consort in the harem now. The only one left to succeed is a little prince who knows nothing. Doesn't that mean I can curry favor with him and seize more power? No, why not emulate Wu Zetian and become the Emperor myself?

(Feeling very tired) It's true what they say — it's harder to go from luxury to frugality. After being pampered in the harem for so many years, I really can't accept going back to a hard life. I don't have grand ambitions; I just hope to spend the rest of my life in peace and wealth. No longer pursuing politics and power. Better to return to the palace, please the young prince, and live as a Dowager Consort without troubling myself with worldly affairs.
I have always longed for a free and easy life, I will not return to the palace.

dialog.content: Alright, I hope you succeed.
I will. I haven’t spent all these years for nothing.
Wishing you all the best.

After bidding farewell to her savior, A Xian set off on her journey back to the capital. Enduring countless hardships, three months later, she finally earned Guangfu’s trust in a city near the capital and was welcomed back to the royal palace. Upon her return, she effortlessly sidelined the five-year-old emperor, seized control of the government, and began her days ruling from behind the scenes.
Alright then, I respect your decision.
Thank you for always being there for me.
Axian left the palace for good and settled in a remote village, living the rest of her days as a village woman, enjoying a carefree and joyful life.
How dare you, meddling in these affairs is simply out of line.
(kneeling) Your Majesty, I realize my mistake, and I will never dare to do it again.
The Emperor felt discontent with Axian’s interference in state affairs and gradually distanced himself from her. In the end, Axian lived out her days in solitude within the imperial harem.
(After the autumn hunt) Oh no, oh no, His Majesty is furious and wants to hold us accountable.
Mistress, was there something wrong with the ceremonial outfit I designed?

It's not that it was bad. In fact, His Majesty quite liked it at the time. But on the day of the hunt, the outfit was too cumbersome, affecting his mobility, and as a result, he couldn't perform well and lost face.
So, Mistress, what should we do? The Emperor won't have us executed, will he? Perhaps you should take the blame, that way the loss would be minimized.

Before Axian or the Mistress could take any action, an imperial decree was issued. Because Axian's designed outfit hindered the Emperor during the hunt, the Embroidery Workshop was prosecuted, and Axian was also implicated and sentenced to be flogged to death.
